verses.text: Night after night on my bed I longed for my lover. I longed for him but he was nowhere to be found.
I will rise and go over the city, its streets and its squares - I will seek my beloved! But I could not find him.
I was found by the watchmen who passed on their round of the city. "Tell me," I said, "Have you seen my beloved?"
Scarce had I parted from them when I found my beloved. I held him and would not let go, until I brought him to my mother’s home, to the room of my conceiving.
Swear, O girls of Jerusalem, by the gazelles and wild does, don’t disturb our love before we are satisfied!
Who is this coming up from the desert like columns of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, all scents of the merchant?
Look! It is Solomon’s litter, and round it three score valiant men of the valiant of Israel,
each with a sword in his hand, and acquainted with war – every man with a sword at his side ready for the dangers of night.
The king had a palanquin made him of Lebanon wood.
Its posts he had fashioned of silver; its back was of gold. Its seat was of purple: within it was inlaid with ebony.
Come forth and look on the king, daughters of Zion, in the crown he received from his mother the day he was wedded, with gladness of heart.
